titleStmt.title: A worke entytled of ye olde god [and] the newe of the olde faythe [and] the newe, of the olde doctryne and ye newe, or orygynall begynnynge of idolatrye. Reade most gentel reader, for many [and] diuers causes this moost goodly boke ...
Vom alten und neuen Gott, Glauben und Lere. English
titleStmt.author: Vadianus, Joachim, 1484-1551.
Turner, William, d. 1568.

publicationStmt.publisher: In fletestrete by me Iohan Byddell, dwelling at ye sygne of our Lady of pite, next to Flete brydge [for William Marshall],
publicationStmt.date: M.v.C.xxxiiij. [sic, i.e. 1534] ye xv. day of Iune]

notesStmt.note: A translation by William Turner of the Latin translation by Hartman Dulichius of: Vadianus, Joachim. Vom alten und neuen Gott, Glauben und Lere.
Imprint from colophon; Marshall's role as publisher from STC.
Reproductions of the originals in the Bodleian Library and the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Appears at reel 159 (Bodleian Library copy) and at reel 373 (Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery copy).

place.placeName: ye sygne of our Lady of pite, next to Flete brydge [
